page.title: 02MOUNT CABURN
page.content: {Mount Caburn}is a huge hill about 500 feet high. From the top you can look out over the {Sussex Weald,} along the South Downs and the Ouse valley to Newhaven and the sea. There is a seat at the top to rest and enjoy the view. Mount Caburn has two ditches right the way round which used to help protect the{Iron-age }people from the{Romans}and other enemies. Mount Caburn has holes where people were buried. The holes are called {barrows. People have dug up these barrows to find signs of{Iron-age} skeletons and urns or pots. Caburn is an ancient hill and has legends about the devil and giants being imprisoned there. There are small craters made by bombs from the second world war. Now it is covered in grass and nettles and wild flowers.
